entry.title: dwarf pufferfish (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that at a maximum standard length of roughly 2 cm (0.8 in), dwarf pufferfish are some of the smallest pufferfish in the world?

entry.title: Clara Thalmann (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Swiss athlete Clara Thalmann arrived in Barcelona to compete in the People's Olympiad but ended up fighting in the Spanish Civil War?

entry.title: Roberts Point Track (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Hende's Hut on Roberts Point Track, a tramping track in New Zealand, originally had no windows?

entry.title: Rachel Yakar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that soprano Rachel Yakar, who received international attention in 1977 as Poppea with Nikolaus Harnoncourt, was also described as an "ideal" Mélisande and "a Mozartian at heart and in style"?

entry.title: an Idaho TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in its first full month on the air, an Idaho TV station had the highest prime-time viewing share of any independent station in the United States?

entry.title: city council of Surabaya (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in the 1909 election to the city council of Surabaya, less than 1 percent of the population could vote?

entry.title: Tale of the Moon Cuckoo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that each performance of the Tale of the Moon Cuckoo lasted for an entire month?

entry.title: Saikabo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Korean restaurant in Japan Saikabo suffered a 30% drop in sales after the South Korean president visited the disputed Liancourt Rocks?
